title: Film in the television age
creator_contributor_role: New York Center for Visual History, production company
KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.), production company
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - History
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - United States - History
description: Episode number 8 of Series "American cinema". Television arrived in American homes just as the Hollywood studio system was collasping. As the new medium took hold, so did a new era in motion picture entertainment. Renown directors, film scholars and actors trace the influence of each medium upon the other; from the live and fresh dramas of the Golden Age of Television and the growth of Hollywood spectacles to the modern day megalithic entertainment industry.
